definition: not to know/unaware/unknowingly/fig. not to admit (defeat, hardships, tiredness etc)
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: lit. to reply "don't know" whatever the question (idiom)/fig. absolutely no idea of what's going on/complete ignorance
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
to have no sense of shame
to have no sense of shame/brazen
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to live in plenty without appreciating it (idiom); not to know when one is well off
pinyin: shen1 zai4 fu2 zhong1 bu4 zhi1 fu2

definition: lit. to eat without tasting the food/worried or downhearted (idiom)
one may know a person for a long time without understanding his true nature (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhi1 mian4 bu4 zhi1 xin1

sentences.english: What the little boys didn't know was that a second train was heading straight for them.
sentences.chinese: 另一列火車正朝他們駛過來，兩個小男孩卻渾然不知。

sentences.english: Thy Lord knows best, and He has the clouds and the sun at His disposal. --Selected.
sentences.chinese: 你的主無所不知，雲和太陽，都受他的使喚與調節。

sentences.english: Embracing warm blood, I sing of youth without regret. Look upon the horizon and know not when my ally would return.
sentences.chinese: 滿腔熱血唱出青春無悔，望穿天涯不知戰友何時回。

sentences.english: “Are you aware how many people have been killed in Kashmir?
sentences.chinese: 你知不知道有多少人在可設米爾喪生？

sentences.english: That uncertain thing was swelled bigger.
sentences.chinese: 那個不知叫什麼的東西膨脹得更大了。

sentences.english: Vujacic said he wasn't sure when he suffered the avulsion fracture.
sentences.chinese: 武賈西奇說，他並不知道什麼時候骨頭撕脫了。

sentences.english: Marianne hardly knew what to say.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗安簡直不知說什麼好。

sentences.english: I catch a cold these days, do not know what to patulin buy is gift nice?
sentences.chinese: 我這幾天感冒，不知買什麼感冒藥纔好？

sentences.english: Somehow, I just don''t like to change horses in the middle of the stream.
sentences.chinese: 不知什麼緣故，我就是不喜歡中途換人。

sentences.english: Tonight Moon people look, do not know song falls whose home.
sentences.chinese: 今夜月明人盡望，不知秋思落誰家。

sentences.english: For unknown reasons, people with alcoholic liver disease often have hepatitis C as well.
sentences.chinese: 不知什麼原因，人們往往與酒精性肝病和丙型肝炎。

sentences.english: The light changed and they drove on, but Hannah was too young to be reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 燈變綠了他們繼續開着，但是漢娜太小不知事理。

sentences.english: Unconsciously, and Buck Street, has been dealing with for nearly 2 years more.
sentences.chinese: 不知不覺中，和布客街已經打交道了快2年多了。

sentences.english: Dick found himself walking in the direction of the church.
sentences.chinese: 迪克發現自己不知不覺朝教堂方向走去。

sentences.english: Slowly insidiously the fog of the everyday has returned to enshroud me.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地，不知不覺地，日常的迷霧又回來籠罩了我。

sentences.english: So do all who live to see such times, but that is not for them to decide.
sentences.chinese: 當局者迷，你可能並不知道該是換新工作的時候了。

definition: unexpectedly/actually/to go so far as to/indeed
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
not to be concerned/regardless of/no matter
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
to be totally oblivious (to sth)/to have no idea about sth
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
whatever/no matter what (who, how etc)/regardless of/not to discuss
